comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Before the Suffragette Caravan left New York for Boston, pulled by a balky horse the ladies had named "Asquith," the participants released several Boston homing pigeons, whose flight home was supposed to precede their own arrival in that city. Here is a contemporary newspaper clipping about the event: www.elizabethfreeman.org/PDF/suffrage/bostonPigeons_big.pdf

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Wystan:

Thank you for the additional information.  We will expand the record when we update and will be adding the names of Elisabeth Freeman and Elsie McKenzie.
